title: (x) LXG movie logo - Bank Gothic, Felina Gothic {JMC, Patricia}
content:
Hi there,   
   
I am trying to identify the font that was used for the poster artwork of "The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen".   
   
My sample is pretty big, so I'll just link to it:   
 [Sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111091200/http:/www.adventurefan.de/birdseed/lxg_font.jpg)   
   
I am not sure, but I think the white font and the greenish font are the same. However, the white font uses capital letters only for the 'L' in 'League', the 'E' in 'Extraordinary' and the 'G' in Gentlemen whereas the green font is all in captions.   
Thus I'd assume that only capital letters have those spikes.   
   
In case I am wrong and it is indeed two different fonts that were used, then I'd be very grateful to find out both font types.   
   
Thanks for your help,   
Chris
author: chris_tc

comments.content:
The white font is Bank Gothic, though bolder than the sample linked. The caps are definitely (I think) another font.   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/bank-gothic/medium/testdrive.html?s=THE+LEAGUE&p=72](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111091200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/bank-gothic/medium/testdrive.html?s=THE%2BLEAGUE&p=72)   
   
I keep searching.
Greenish font and caps for white font are [Felina Gothic.](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111091200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/felina-gothic/)

Thanks so much for helping me out!   
   
-Chris
